text.tspan: the user types ‘sp’ in the filter input field
this results in a backend call
searching for all recipes whose name contains ‘sp’

g.title: this results in a backend call searching for all recipes whose name contains ‘sp’

text.tspan: for some reason this requests takes

g.title: the user types ‘sp’ in the filter input field

text.tspan: meanwhile, the user changes his mind and

g.title: this results in a backend call searching for all recipes whose name contains ‘sp’

text.tspan: this results in a second backend request
this time looking for recipes whose name contains ‘la’

g.title: this results in a backend call searching for all recipes whose name contains ‘sp’

text.tspan: somehow this second request returns immediately

g.title: this results in a backend call searching for all recipes whose name contains ‘sp’

text.tspan: after some time, the original request, filtering on ‘sp’,

g.title: the user types ‘sp’ in the filter input field

text.tspan: this results in two states being out of sync,
while the filter (and url) show ‘la’, the recipelist is filtered using ‘sp’
